title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message:
First i want to say that this forum is awesome. Thank you Duke!!!

I am working on a 820-3787 board

When i start the machine i got no video. The backlight is there. The machine is booting but i cannot see a picture. When the machine boots i can hear a sound when pressing the enter key for example. This means that the machine is booting fine. There is no video on HDMI and no video on DP.

i meassured all the voltages for GPU rails. They are all fine. Don´t know what to do next. I know that there are two graphic cards and that the Mux is controlling them. But no idea how to make the next step.
I forgot to mention that the board is not water damaged and looks abolutely fine. No corrosion at all.

Any ideas?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: You sure the backlight is there, is the Apple logo lit up? If backlight is present the LCD should also work so I suspect a bad LCD assembly.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message:
Thank you Duke!

Yes, i´m 100% sure. The Apple logo lit up.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: If the LCD is bad then i would have a picture on HDMi or DP? Am i right?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Disconnect internal LCD and boot with LCD connected to DP port through VGA/DVI adapter. Should have boot screen then

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: i already tried this with disconnected internal LCD. No screen

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: I still think a bad LCD. If backlight works it means eDP interface to LCD is ok. Find a test assembly for the correct year of the machine.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Ok, but what about the fact that there is no HDMI and DP output?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Don't know how 3787 behaves with boot screen through DP. Sometimes the OS needs to fully load the drivers for it to work.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Ok, thank you Duke ! I´ll try to find a known good Display and try my best. Maybe even the HDMI is working only when the OS is fully loaded

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message:
OK, thank you Duke! I´ll try to find a known good Display for test. Maybe even HDMI is only working when OS is fully loaded.
Ohhh, i posted this twice.....hehe

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Just an update...... When i plug the HDMI cable in i can see the extern LCD Monitor looks like the internal LCD. It´s just the same. You can see a black screen and it´s shining like the backlight from the internal LCD.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Is this when the machine is booted in OSX?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: It´s from the beginning on

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: I hade the same problem with a3115 card and change the lvds connector after that i got pictures

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: 3115 is LVDS this board is eDP. eDP works or it doesn't, there is no in between.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message:
Hello Duke,

ok, now i tested with a known good display. No screen. Than i tested my display on the other machine. Working fine. Now it´s 100% sure that the Logic Board is faulty.

Any ideas?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Seeing that HDMI and eDP give the exact same symptoms I would suspect the GPU is bad.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Duke, is it possible to get this graphic chip? Any informations about that?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Check Ebay or Ali. Honestly I would not continue with this repair, too much risk of failure, fake chips etc.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: One last general question....... What are you telling your customers when a board is not fixible or like in my case with this board. What advice can i give. To sell the machine as defect? :))

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: I just say I cannot fix it, case closed. Probably the best option is to dump it on Ebay, prices for such machines even broken are stupid high. Probably $500 for a broken one.....

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: Did you check L8300?

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message: It is eDP interface, only one data line has to have an issue and there is no image/backlight, nothing.

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message:
Chip chip. Which is gpu chip?
​​​​

title: MacBook Pro A1398 820-3787 no video on display
message:
[USER="557"]MDY[/USER]

i didn´t check it anymore. I follow Duke´s advice. It´s better to not put my hands on this graphic chip and change it when chance is high to get a problem later on.
Therefore the customer will get this machine back.
